measured_by: open-ended self-report donation amount question (e.g., “How much are you willing to donate…? __ $”)
justification: Throughout the studies, participants’ willingness to donate was elicited by asking them to type any dollar amount they wished to donate in a free-text box (e.g., “How much are you willing to donate to help these 100 children? Please enter the amount…: __ $”).

measured_by: open-ended self-report valuation question (e.g., “How much money do you think is needed…? __ $”)
justification: In Study 4, the dependent variable switched to a contingent valuation format where participants were asked, “How much money do you think is needed to buy Christmas gifts for these 50 children? Please indicate the amount here: __ $,” recording their valuation as an open response.

measured_by: single Likert-type item (1 = not at all – 7 = yes, absolutely) asking about trying to be consistent
justification: Each Unit Asking condition included the item: “In doing so, were you trying to be consistent? … (1 = not at all, 4 = somewhat, 7 = yes, absolutely),” capturing participants’ desire to be consistent.
